Class LogWindow

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container

                • org.statcato.LogWindow
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.Scrollable

    public class LogWindow
extends javax.swing.JTextPane
implements java.io.Serializable
    A log text pane containing HTML-formatted text.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    %I%, %G%
    Author:
    Margaret Yau
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • LogWindow

        public LogWindow(Statcato mTab)
        Constructor, given the parent application object.
        Parameters:
        mTab - parent application object

    • Method Detail

      • addParagraph

        public void addParagraph(java.lang.String heading,
                java.lang.String message)
        Adds the given heading and text message to this object. The heading followed by the message are appended to the end of the HTML document in this object.
        Parameters:
        heading - heading string
        message - message string

      • addText

        public void addText(java.lang.String message)
        Adds the given message to this object. The message is appended to the end of the HTML document in this object.
        Parameters:
        message - a string to be added to this object

      • addUnformattedText

        public void addUnformattedText(java.lang.String message)
        Adds the given message (as is) to this object. The message is appended to the end of the HTML document in this object.
        Parameters:
        message - a string to be added to this object

      • addHeading

        public void addHeading(java.lang.String message)
        Adds the given message as a heading to this object. The message is appended to the end of the HTML document in this object in bold font.
        Parameters:
        message - a string to be added to this object

      • setChangedStatus

        public void setChangedStatus()
        Sets the status of this object to changed. Adds an asterisk to the log window title to indicate a change to the log window has occured.

      • setUnchangedStatus

        public void setUnchangedStatus()
        Sets the status of this object to unchanged. Removes the asterisk in the log window title to indicate the log window has no unsaved contents.

      • getChangedStatus

        public boolean getChangedStatus()
        Returns the changed status.
        Returns:
        changed status

      • writeToFile

        public java.io.File writeToFile(javax.swing.JFrame frame,
                       boolean saveAs)
        Writes the HTML source of this log window object to a file. Prompts the user to select a file location if this object has not previously been saved or if forced to save in a new file.
        Parameters:
        frame - the parent frame
        saveAs - a boolean value indicating whether to save as a new file
        Returns:
        the file containing the saved contents, or null if the save action fails

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clears the text in this log window and reintializes.

      • overwrite

        public void overwrite(java.lang.String txt)
        Replaces the contents of this log window with the given string.

      • appendLog

        public void appendLog(java.lang.String log)
